org.xchain.framework.lifecycle

Class XmlFactoryLifecycle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xchain.framework.lifecycle.XmlFactoryLifecycle

  • public class XmlFactoryLifecycle
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a common place to manage factories for the TrAX and SAX APIs, by allowing the creation of several named factories.
    Author:
    Christian Trimble, John Trimble, Josh Kennedy

      • putSaxParserFactoryFactory

        public static void putSaxParserFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name,
                              Factory<javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory> factory)
        Puts a new SAXParserFactory factory into the XmlFactoryLifecycle with the specified name. If a factory is already bound to the specified name, it is removed.

      • getSaxParserFactoryFactory

        public static Factory<javax.xml.parsers.SAXParserFactory> getSaxParserFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)

      • putTransformerFactoryFactory

        public static void putTransformerFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name,
                                Factory<javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory> factory)

      • getTransformerFactoryFactory

        public static Factory<javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory> getTransformerFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
        Returns the Factory that is mapped to the specified name, or null if there is no such factory.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the factory to return.
        Returns:
        the Factory that is mapped to the specified name, or null if there is no such factory.

      • removeTransformerFactoryFactory

        public static Factory<javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory> removeTransformerFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
        Removes the Factory with the specifed name. The factory that was removed is returned.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Factory that will be removed.
        Returns:
        the factory that was removed, or null if there was not a factory with that specified name.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this lifecycle is running when this method is called.

      • newTransformerFactory

        public static javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory newTransformerFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name)
        Creates a new SAXTransformerFactory based on the Factory registered with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Factory to use.
        Returns:
        the new SAXTransformerFactory that was created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if there is not a factory with the specified name.

        public static javax.xml.transform.sax.SAXTransformerFactory newTransformerFactory(java.lang.String uri,
                                                                  java.lang.String localName,

      • newTemplatesHandler

        public static SaxTemplatesHandler newTemplatesHandler()
        Creates a templates handler that does not cache the templates object that is returned. The templates objects from this method cannot be cached, as there is no reliable way to create the sax stream that is associated with the use of this templates handler. If you want to create a cacheable and reloadable templates object, please ask for the templates object by system id from the newTemplates( String ) method. This will create a sax stream for the templates object, cache the object, and watch for changes to the

      • putDocumentBuilderFactoryFactory

        public static void putDocumentBuilderFactoryFactory(javax.xml.namespace.QName name,
                                    Factory<javax.xml.parsers.DocumentBuilderFactory> factory)
        Puts a new DocumentBuilderFactory factory into the XmlFactoryLifecycle with the specified name. If a factory is already bound to the specified name, it is removed.
